result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mostafa Bifinzi

Defendant Mostafa Bifinzi in court, in custody.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for Mostafa Bifinzi.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Sworn as interpreter: Ayman Khatib, Arabic Interpreter.

Case in Court for Status Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Parties provided update to the Court regarding Defendants other case 19CF279 calendared in branch 34. For reasons stated on the record State requested Status Conference date. Defense did not object. Defense advised the Court of possible Motion to Modify Bail. Court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 45.
Status conference scheduled for February 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Status Conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 8:30 am has been rescheduled for October 12, 2022 at 9:00 am. Hearing will be in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Clerk has notified parties.

Defendant Mostafa Bifinzi in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Patrick J Leigl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Status Conference. Defendant is wanted in the the State of California. The defendant was served with a governor's warrant on todays date. The Court ordered the defendant remanded. The Court ordered this case to tag along with the defendants pending case in Branch 34.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Amanda Poznanski; filed.
Sworn as Arabic interpreter:  Khajib Ayman

Defendant Mostafa Bifinzi in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Mostafa Bifinzi in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mostafa Bifinzi appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Illinois
Defendant contested extradition.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/ed5b9ae0-0153-fff4-9924-88d8db5a37c1  Status conference scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
